s.text: The big surprise is the discovery of talent in director Curtis Hanson, who was roundly drubbed for a previous film, The Hand That Rocks the Cradle . "Nothing in Hanson's previous work ...

The subject of religious ambivalence is called daring, the treatment of it smart and sophisticated.

In a lengthy New Republic review, sociologist Alan Wolfe mostly praises the Thernstroms' tome on race: Their "tough-minded book serves the cause of racial justice."
Book -- America in Black and White: One Nation, Indivisible , by Stephan and Abigail Thernstrom.
Book -- Simenon: A Biography , by Pierre Assouline, translated by Jon Rothschild;
Book -- The Farewell Symphony , by Edmund White;
